author: {'steamid': '76561198137159594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1711187984}
review:
I wish I could give the game a neutral review, with a very slight tendency toward positive.
This seems to be a game designed to play together with your little ones. 
If you don't have children, I guess it is perfectly serviceable as a quick, basic adventure for those who find themselves absolutely starved for a P&C game. If you're curious about it yourself, I recommend getting this on sale.

Let's get my major gripes with the game out of the way first:
-While I personally think the visual style is unappealing (like an old flash game), it does have enough detail and charm to not be [i]completely[/i] hideous. You'll come across plenty of problems with the layering of characters and environmental objects, which will break what little immersion there is to begin with.
-The characters are not deep or all that interesting (with one particularly weird exception), but distinguishable enough to remember. Most of them not by name though, I just finished the game and can't recall any of the names of the main cast. I simply had no reason to care.
-The puzzles are of standard P&C flavor, use items on things in your environment, occasionally combine them in your inventory and progress through some dialogue to trigger events. The latter aspect could use a LOT of work though:
Don't expect any bizarre and brilliantly written dialogues akin to the majority of Monkey Island games, what you have to deal with here is very basic and has humor which can either be described as childish or mind-numbingly dull.
-Speaking of dialogues, whenever a character has to say more than one line, there's a noticeable delay between the sentences being delivered. I imagine this may be by design, so very young children don't have to process all of it at once, but to me it simply seemed like a "crap factor" I had to adjust to. Made me accidentally skip lines, because I thought they were done talking and I wanted to continue exploring.
-While the game has a feature to point out interactables in a scene, it doesn't always work really well, because some of them are obscured by foreground objects and the player has to move to the corner of the screen to properly see them.
-I feel like there's so much wasted potential. I mean, your main cast consists of time-travelling scientists, who also happen to be a rock band! That premise alone opens up so many crazy and imaginative opportunities, but it doesn't really go anywhere meaningful.

With all these issues being present, what's there to redeem the game?

-This feels like a rather personal project. It felt to me like it gave an insight into the things the devs were personally fond of and the characters might be superficially based on themselves or people they know. I think it's kinda nice to get a little glimpse of that. Shout-out to the reference to the British claymation series The Trapdoor! Good stuff! c:
-It is mostly "family friendly" (but since the writing is quite sloppy, I wouldn't let a very young child play it alone, there are a handful of questionable aspects to it).
-While I played the majority of the game completely stone-faced, there are a small number of actually smart jokes.
-It feels, naturally, very British, which I did find quite enjoyable. Especially the aspect of rock band traveling in a submarine. We all know what this is a reference to! c:
-The devs seem to genuinely care about their game. Even now, many years after it's release, issues posted on the steam forums get addressed immediately! I was unable to finish the game due to a bug, I reported it and two days later the game received an update! Fantastic service!
-While it first seemed that the villain of the story was merely a one-dimensional afterthought, the ending changed that completely. In hindsight, the ending is pretty dark and twisted, which came as an amazing surprise, contrasting the overall flatness of the story. Not only does this open up the opportunity to have a somewhat philosophical discussion, but also the possibility to do so much more with the sequel, should there ever be one! Work on your writing, wait a few years until your current intended audience has matured a little and turn this into a heart-wrenching story coupled with some grey morality, but plenty of "more mature" jokes! Again, so much potential!

While I can't see myself ever playing this game again, it made me curious about the studio's next project, just to see where they improved.

review: Funny how good the voice acting is despite how unsightly this game looked (and my standards are low! I am usually not fazed by mid 2000s flash game looking doodoo graphics). There are also some odd obscure puzzle solutions sure but what sent me over the edge is how buggy it is! Game stopped mid-cutscene and I couldn't proceed! Audio sometimes get chopped, losing immersion. I am no longer interested in finishing this
developer_response: HI there, I have just updated the game and now all those problems will be resolved! Hope you get to finish the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198411999848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1591539220}
review:
I actually really liked the game. Great graphics, an okay storyline. Got stuck a few times, but soon found out how to get further. Was unfortunately quite buggy. For the amount I paid when it first came out, I was very disapointed that the game just froze at the near end. So I never got to finish it and I guess not find out the mystery of woolley mountain. Which probably doesn´t mean alot. I´m thinking about the secret of monkey island here. But none the less, unsatisfactory.

I might give it another try one day, since the game has been been patched.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972434568', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1559932571}
review:
Its a solid point and click, nothing really to complain about. 

-Nice art-style, 
-Great voice acting, 
-Well written dialog with plenty of humor.
-Engaging story.
-Interesting puzzle design, some tricky parts but overall very enjoyable.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293227795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1648226730}
review:
Es ist ein lustiges, leider etwas kurzes Spiel mit toller Grafik, wahnsinnig guter Musik, spannender Story und viel britischem Humor. Auch Untertitel sind vorhanden.
Meine einzige Beschwerde ist, dass die englische Sprachausgabe teilweise sehr schwer zu verstehen ist, weil die Sprecher mit verschiedenen Dialekten (aus dem Raum UK) sprechen.

Es ist auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198301417354', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1667242620}
review:
Nice and a little weird adventure about friends, who help another friend out of his misery with a witch.  Characters are special, we have even a robot, who belongs to the party.  After Vandamme ran into a trap, when he tried to free children from their imprisonment at the local witch, the friends are about to help him.  All not easy, as one of the tasks is: bring them all together ...

Many comical notions, had to laugh often ! For those, who like arcade minigames, there are some, not obligatory, but you may have that little fun in between. All in all, it is not a too difficult game, bit rather entertaining !

Don't miss it, highly recommended !

author: {'steamid': '76561198995387103', 'num_games_owned': 6510, 'num_reviews': 3379, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1660575626}

author: {'steamid': '76561198286724621', 'num_games_owned': 2514, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1651072188}

author: {'steamid': '76561198179565378', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1647859490}
review: The game was very well put together, with some good puzzles, nice retro references (without beating the player over the head with those), and was fun overall. All that up to a certain point, where things kinda went south. Towards the end, everything felt rushed, and puzzles stopped making sense. However, that was a short part, and although it soured the taste a bit, it's safe to say that the game was pretty enjoyable in its whole.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972773317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1640733935}
review:
A bit too buggy for a general recommendation.
Also dialog doesn't adapt to progress: If you do things in another order than the creators intended, it will sometimes say stuff that hasn't happened yet, or ignore stuff that's already happened.
And it's annoyingly unclear most of the time what is just decoration you can play around with, and what you actually need to spend time with to progress.
Like in most adventure games, if there's not enough subtle hints and good dialogue to make the player aware of the next necessary step to take, it too often comes down to haphazardly trying everything in the inventory.
The in-game storyline is OK, and mostly enjoyable to play. Some of the puzzles like the rope duel and the dream sequence are great new ideas and really well done!
But if I'm given a crew of five, I would have much more enjoyed to make use of their special capabilities, instead of making the whole game basically about tricking them to come along at all, and then having them hang about uselessly.
Also, the background lore is utter rubbish. Allegedly those guys are some sort of famous rock band? But nobody seems to recognize them. But their logo is senselessly plastered everwhere. But it actually is a symbol for time travel. And none of the alleged musicians ever makes any useful sound at all...
And I won't even criticize the lame old time-loop meme. That's just par for the course, and kind of expected at this level of storytelling quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143418842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1622463527}
review: Woolley Mountain was really fun and charming! I’m quite new to point and click games, so I enjoyed the puzzles being fairly logical, challenging sometimes, but just to the right extent. And great job on the music and the voice acting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198324540806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1561895745}
review:
This game is so frustrating, but kind of addictive at the same time!
It's got a fair amount of odd characters, interesting music, different environments, all bundled up with a really simple point and click vibe.
It's classic stuff, and it's just very... I found myself going back and forth through each level multiple times clicking on everything and slowly working out how to get items to interact with the characters etc, and it's a beautiful world to be immersed in while doing this - weird characters all with their own vibe and mini story, posters on the walls all suggest easter egg vibes if you know the right bands or played the right games in years gone by - I get the feeling there's so many references I've missed!

Every time I got so annoyed/stuck that I had to take a break, I found myself diving back in ten minutes later!
Hours and hours and hours of fun and frustration! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198152612238', 'num_games_owned': 2058, 'num_reviews': 656, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1615986913}
review: 总体感觉不太好吧，主要这个游戏的解题思路实在是很诡异，和制作者的脑洞匹配不到一起去，就得疯狂看攻略了。然后开船去了酒馆之后，还遇到了bug。就是突然回到船上，又来一遍开船动画。5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056350187', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1634981621}
review:
So a few months ago I played "The Mystery Of Woolley Mountain" on Switch and thought it was a good little adventure game. And then one day, the developer asked if I wanted to try the Steam version and I thought that was really nice. Most of my points from the Switch version are still there such as:

-Tells you exactly what you you have to do and item hints are very clear. Like saying looks like Auto so it's one of the keys to get him back
-As amateur as it is, I find the art style charming
-Has a final boss.
-The voice acting. While voices like Garland and Roland were good, other's like Auto and the evil witch were just bad.
-The dream sequence. Not that it was bad but felt the most like filler.
-Tilda is just Penny Proud from the Proud Family but with a adult British voice.

As for changes or updates since I last played it, well they steam lined the adventure a bit by cutting the minigames for the main quest. Most of them are still there but they aren't mandatory anymore like the friendship bracelet is on the arcade cabinet when you interact with it and the text adventure has been cut entirely.

They also made things more clear like the how to win the rope game and have redesign some sections since the creators seem to be replacing word based puzzle with picture ones like the Dream section is no longer a scrabble puzzle but just match pictures to the room. Although I prefer the original version of the section, I understand the change since not everyone uses our alphabet. Also they change the song the Colins Brothers sing and it’s way better.

Unfortunately, that leads to the biggest issue currently in the game, and that’s the changes have broken the game in places. I work as a tester so I understand if a change may break something and luckily, the serious game-breaking ones seem to be dealt with as I manage to get to the end but there a few issues with the presentation like Chandi’s body being missing during Garland’s speech on the way to the base of the mountain or the ending voiceover before the credits starting to skip after the 3rd sentence.

I think it just needs a bug tester or two to look through the game with a fine tooth comb as the developers really want this to be the best it can be as they’ve been responsive when I was reporting the game breaking Dream Section. And it deserves to be the best it can be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1604236276}
review:
This is a console ported (Nintendo Switch) 2D classical point and click family friendly  adventure game with cartoony/MS-Paint style artwork and a surreal/comedy plot. 

A fair bit of effort went into trying to rebuild the spirit of games like Curse of Monkey Island from scratch, but the delivery here is very average.  It's not bad, but it's not going to win any awards either.  The writing is flat, the jokes feel forced and contrived.   The characters are unengaging.  It's just hard to get into. 

While this might be a fun game for parents to play with their younger children, it's not really the first game I would recommend for that.  A lot of work did go into the game, but there's no "maybe" option when asked if I recommend this game, so I don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198881545899', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1604032205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198274645594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1589792335}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198008045716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1585502857}
review:
Not overly long, but good enough to keep me interested through a boring sunday. Lots of retro gags as you would expect from Ron Gilbert (ask me about LOOM) and this genre. A few glitches such as in the letter sequence, but some nice vocal work, silliness and adventuring fun.
Think I reached for the walkthru about 6 times?
Worth it for what I paid (although I would still like to play DOTT again if someone will recompile it in 64bit :P
developer_response: Hi there, thanks for playing Woolley Mountain, sorry you had a bit of trouble with some glitches in the letter sequence, these have been ironed out in the new update! Thanks again

author: {'steamid': '76561197991720927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1583232632}
review: Nice art style, decent voice acting and very silly British humor, but, the story line is only passable and the game play and puzzles are not very interesting or challenging. Overall, I still recommend it, but I'm a bit disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205895069', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1580590862}
review:
Wolley Mountain es un buen juego pero que no destaca en ningún apartado. La historia y (casi todos) los puzzles son correctos pero no ofrecen nada nuevo al género. Podría ser un juego para alguien que comienza en los point&click. Nunca me terminé de enganchar mucho con los personajes, no hay ninguno que sea muy interesante a tal punto que no estoy seguro de poder nombrarlos a todos habiendo terminado recién el juego. Sí me gustó el twist del final.
Hay algunos pequeños problemas de usabilidad al usar los objetos y al moverse por las escenas pero no llegan a ser molestos.
Considerando que el juego fue hecho por una persona diría que igual vale la pena jugarlo aunque no creo que lo recordemos mucho luego.

Puntaje final: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198207093868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1580548973}

I absolutely love the Brit accents, really makes the game fun. Puzzles were great and enjoyed solving them.  Really, a nice game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287521749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1572295983}
review: Cant moan at the price, and it is a good game if you like point n click adventures

author: {'steamid': '76561198380904117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1562907571}
review: It runs well and looks good, but the game play wasn't great.  I recommend this game only if you are really, really, really  into basic point n click adventure stories.  It had a couple humorous moments, but was otherwise boring.  I think I was just disappointed because I enjoyed the demo and the game wasn't what I expected.   I assumed there would  be additional mini-games and puzzles (non-inventory), but there weren't.  The only mini-game, not included in the demo, was just a pixelated version of the game included in the demo.  The majority of the puzzles were fetch quests, conversation based, or inventory based.  Thankfully, there weren't many ridiculous item combinations needed.  It only took a few hours to complete the game, but I was glad when it was over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143247112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1561235654}
review:
Nice point and click adventure. Atmosphere draws you in and the puzzles are fairly logical. British humour, very nice audio, with extra care done to the voicelines. Polished graphics and the backgrounds have got a lot of attention.

Very nice first game from a new developer. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198820154780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1567018970}
review: Being a huge fan of point and click adventures such as Monkey island and Simon the sorcerer I loved The Mystery Of Woolley Mountain. With its hilarious characters and great British humour this is up there with the best of them. It has a good storyline, puzzles and brilliant retro references. I hope there's a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203024993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1593439293}
review: I enjoyed how difficult parts were, but overall I found the storyline very tedious, and the characters annoying

author: {'steamid': '76561198108082567', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1557309480}
review:
这是一款典型的第三人称点击式冒险解密游戏，虽然目前只有英文版，但不久之后，即将推出官方中文版。
据我说知，目前正有一群人为此而不懈努力着！
总体来说，游戏的可玩性还是不错的。画面也很有特色，可以看出作者在制作上的用心。
本作的故事剧情并不复杂，讲述了一群科学家前往一个叫做“巫雷山”的危险之地，拯救一群孩子们的故事。当然，故事听上去有些俗套，但游戏中的细节还是让人可以沉浸其中的。
更重要的是，该游戏在道具的使用上颇有创意——要胆子大，脑洞大，才会发现道具的真正用法。
游戏中有很多细节值得探究，可以说是包含了作者对游戏事业的热情。

author: {'steamid': '76561198199471263', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1555521044}
review: The story is fresh and not repetitive, brings back the old feeling of point and click games. It's a good turn up from a modern fps game, it's easy to play and pretty addictive too. Would recommend buying this

author: {'steamid': '76561198141032243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1605587948}
review: I haven't gotten very far into this game yet (my brain for these kinds of games isn't what it used to be) but so far I really like it. The design of the characters and backgrounds is fantastic and the music is excellent, as I'd expect from the fellas from The Helmholtz Resonators! If you've listened to their music, you'll find some familiar tunes in this game, and they are used very effectively. The voice acting is also really entertaining (at times I feel like there are a couple of lines that sound a bit quiet, and could benefit from a re-recording, but this is a very minor quibble). This game is very much for those who loved the old LucasArts Point-N-Click adventure games - I am a huge fan of Day of the Tentacle and Grim Fandango, so this game is right up my street. Obviously, it is a little simpler in how it looks, but this is part of its charm. The Lightfoot Bros. have clearly poured a lot of love into this game and I'm really impressed with what I have seen so far - I look forward to playing through the rest of the game. Also, I love the little easter eggs of references to stuff from my childhood (the nod to 'The Trapdoor' almost had me blubbing tears of nostlagia!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198166564105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1556372938}
review:
If you are a fan of good old fashioned point and click, inventory-based adventure games, this is really one for you. It is funny, well written and has excellent graphics and voice acting. The puzzles are challenging, but not too difficult and well integrated in the story, as they should be in a true adventure game. 
With all those walking simulators around, they dont make many games in this genre anymore. I think it is importent that we support developers, who still make games like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198953084264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1691132653}
review: A fantastic game, and one for fans of classics of the genre such as Monkey Island and Day Of The Tentacle. Great graphics, clever puzzles and a real fun story. The voice acting is charming and the adventure is really fun. Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974022186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1555953859}
review:
The Mystery Of Woolley Mountain is a charming and fun point and click adventure game.
It has great hand drawn scenes and nicely-animated characters, an interesting story with plenty to do and the puzzles are not too difficult. I really enjoyed the sound effects and music and the voice acting was great throughout.
Overall there is a lot to like about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012707289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1556485811}
review: Great stuff - literally genius from the start. If you like point and click adventures - this is one of the best!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051635879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1708034111}
review: A very charming adventure game with some quirky characters and interesting puzzles. The music is great and the world really draws you in. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050928840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1574427812}
review: Saw this game at an event. Looked great at the time so I entered into it, it delivers on the early promises I had and so pleased I bought into the game. Never mind comparing the game to any in the past, it does its own thing and I like it for itself. Enjoying a so far balanced well pitched game. Friendly dev, well recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067134877', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1556283897}
review:
PC版通了2遍，NS版1遍，总共玩通3遍，留个评测。
整体游戏节奏明快不拖沓，第一遍正常游戏通关时间在5小时以上。卡通风格画面类似《南方公园》《辛普森一家》，动画演出很一般，尤其是推动剧情时的演出部分。前半段剧情烂俗——主角团从女巫手里拯救孩子，除了结局大反转之外，整个前中期故事乏善可陈。文本量接近3w，人物塑造虽然脸谱化，倒也体现了角色差异，尤其是各种夸张的画面表现（比如科拉蒂尼半夜和女友在幽静的后巷卿卿我我）极尽搞笑之能事。谜题方面，难度中等偏上——部分谜题需要开脑洞才能解开，且游戏制作者对粑粑（对，就是shi）有某种奇怪的情结，若干个谜题都需要用到shi这个关键道具....
总的来说，属于小品级独立游戏里值得一玩的中上之作，对得起37块这个价格。
另外，NS版的操作没有经过专门的优化，非常难受，希望开发者之后可以做些优化。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042068386', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1555612005}
review: what a game. Nice point and click game with good puzzles and nice dialogues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221681156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1555339488}
review:
I think that this was a very good point and click game. It does have the same vibes as Monkey Island. I thought that the animations and the graphics were quite good. The voice acting was very good and entertaining. There were some parts in the game that made me chuckle. Some of the puzzles in the game were quite fun to do yet some of them were challenging. 

For those who are into point and click games similar to Monkey Island, this might be for you. 4 out of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068116100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2599, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1555432193}
review: [b]Wolley Dağı'nın gizemini çözmeye çalıştığınız bu oyunda; birçok maceraya adım atabilirsiniz. İlerleyişi sağlayabilmek için zaman zaman çeşitli nesnelerin birleşimini de sağlamanız gerekebilir. Oyunda yer alan zengin ve etkileşimli içeriklerin yanı sıra, uğraştırıcı bulmacalar da dikkatinizi çekebilecek unsurlar arasında bulunabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031670464', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1555236155}
review:

Στα [-]

author: {'steamid': '76561198204334089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1555238470}
review: I think this game shot itself in the foot by consistently comparing itself to Monkey island. While visuals are similar, I really did not get the same feeling as from Monkey Island so I was kind of disappointed. Jokes in Monkey Island edge on the absurd while these are just silly and childish. It felt like the game was taking down to me and treated me like an idiot. Maybe if I didn't start the game with this expectation I would have been able to enjoy it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198312597511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1693676136}
review: A classic fun point and click.  Took back to my Monkey Island Days.  The plot is fun and the graphics enjoyable with some great puzzles.
